content.raw:
mm gazebo7 already has a `Camera::Project(Vector3d)` function there, I wonder why it didn't fail before.

Changing the function to `Project3d` sounds good. My original plan was to deprecate the one that returns `Vector2i` in `default` and eventually have all of them to return `Vector3d`. Reason being that the projected `z` value is useful to determine if the point is in front or behind the camera.
content.html:
mm gazebo7 already has a Camera::Project(Vector3d) function there, I wonder why it didn't fail before.

Changing the function to Project3d sounds good. My original plan was to deprecate the one that returns Vector2i in default and eventually have all of them to return Vector3d. Reason being that the projected z value is useful to determine if the point is in front or behind the camera.
